text: Chester Zoo is a zoo near Chester. It was opened in 1931. It was built without the traditional iron bars to cage the animals. It covers 125 acres. It was named as the best zoo in the UK and third in the world by TripAdvisor in 2017. 155 of the creatures are classified as threatened species. 134 species are kept as part of a captive breeding programme. == References == Category:Buildings and structures in Cheshire Category:Chester Category:Zoos in the United Kingdom
title: Chester Zoo
